answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
Several thoughts.  In our county our accounting software allows for a variety of financial reports, department, admin or accounting department staff can review in any format they want.  In our county I discourage departments from spending extra time exporting and reformatting reports when standard reports are available on the accounting system.  It just doesn't seem like a good use of time.  Regarding format, I always like reports to be run at the end of a month as opposed to on the date of a meeting, I like to see a prior year to date corresponding revenue / expenditure figure.  For entity wide reports I sometime use an organization report that summarizes departments on one line.

author: Kurt Lockhart
text: The City of Charlottesville is seeking to develop a quarterly reporting system for departments to submit a contextualized financial update to the budget office. In this system, each department would export a budget vs. actual accompanied by explanatory narrative.  Does anyone have examples or recommended formats for this type of process? Thanks in advance for your responses.
title: Quarterly Department Reporting Process
